circumstances: While taking off from Minneapolis-St Paul Airport, the airplane suffered an uncontrolled collision with ground, skidded on runway and came to rest. The aircraft was destroyed and all seven occupants were seriously injured.
probable_cause:
Uncontrolled collision with ground during initial climb due to inadequate preflight preparation on part of the pilot-in-command. The following contributing factors were reported:
- Misused or failed to use flaps, 
- Airframe ice, 
- Incorrect trim setting, 
- Snow, 
- Visibility 3/4 mile or less,
- Snow/ice on wings, 
- Flaps 28°,
- Full nose-up trim.
